title: Children in Need: Dozens join viral drummer to take on BBC News theme tune
description: Owain Wyn Evans played alongside 50 drummers for part of his 24-hour Drumathon for Children in Need.

title: No regrets! Pandemic purchases that made us happy
description: Not everyone has buyer's remorse over what they bought in lockdown. For some, it changed their lives.

title: COP 26: How much are poor countries getting to fight climate change?
description: Are rich countries close to meeting their climate promises to the developing world?

title: Climate change: Do I need to stop eating meat?
description: Some people are switching to plant-based diets to reduce their carbon footprint.

title: England's Genge to miss Australia game after testing positive for Covid-19
description: England prop Ellis Genge tests positive for Covid-19 and will not play against Australia on Saturday.

title: Number of migrants crossing Channel to UK hits new daily record
description: Around 1,000 people reached the UK by boat on Thursday, with more than 20,000 arriving this year.

title: Ron Flowers: Former England international and 1966 squad member dies at 87
description: Former England midfielder Ron Flowers, a non-playing member of Sir Alf Ramsey's squad which won the 1966 World Cup, dies at 87.

title: NFL: Watch the best plays as Dolphins claim upset win over Ravens
description: Watch the best plays as Xavien Howard forces a fumble and returns it for a touchdown to help the Miami Dolphins to a 22-10 upset win over the Baltimore Ravens.

title: Grenfell Tower: Builders 'gaming system' to avoid fire safety rules
description: Hundreds of new buildings are being deliberately designed to avoid fire safety rules, LFB says.

title: AstraZeneca to take profits from Covid vaccine
description: The drugs giant signs new deals, but poorer countries will continue to get the vaccine at cost price.

title: Women warned home working may harm their careers
description: Bank of England economist Catherine Mann says mothers could be particularly vulnerable.

title: COP26: New draft climate deal steps up call for urgent action
description: All countries must agree on the new deal as the COP26 talks enter their final hours.

title: Choreographer Liam Scarlett took own life after misconduct claims
description: An inquest hears a Royal Opera House dancer felt "humiliated" by sexual misconduct allegations.

title: Caerphilly dog attack: Inquest opens into Jack Lis death
description: Jack Lis, 10, died from "severe injuries to the head and neck", an inquest hears.

title: 'Selfies are taking away our livelihood'
description: Temple photographers in this Indian town are struggling to make a living in the age of selfies.

title: Michael Fawcett: Charles' former aide quits charity amid honours inquiry
description: Michael Fawcett faces claims he offered to help a wealthy Saudi donor secure an honour.

title: Ron Jeremy: Porn star's accusers speak out for first time
description: Some of his accusers speak for the first time of their alleged experiences. He denies all charges.

title: Poland border: West condemns Belarus at UN over stranded migrants
description: EU nations, the US and UK say Belarus is putting migrants' lives in danger for political purposes.

title: COP26: Fear of failure on final day, and just how green was summit?
description: Five things you need to know about COP26 - the United Nations climate change conference - on Friday.

title: Watchet's missing goose Derek to get statue
description: The Somerset bird accumulated a worldwide fan base over 10 years before mysteriously disappearing.

title: COP26: Flooding lessons from Hull, a city below sea level
description: Hull has been at COP26 to share its innovative approach to tackling flood threats with the world.

title: Menopause: Bereaved husband urges men to spot mental health signs
description: David Salmon, whose wife Linda took her own life, says he was unaware of the link to mental health.

title: How green was the COP26 climate summit?
description: A report has suggested the carbon footprint of the Glasgow summit is more than double that of COP25.

title: Premier League: Should clubs stop flying to domestic matches for environmental reasons?
description: Premier League clubs regularly fly to away matches but as sport attempts to play its part in tackling the climate crisis, does the practice need to stop?

title: Robbie Savage on making Macclesfield FC: 'The hardest thing I've ever done
description: Former footballer Robbie Savage tells us about the new BBC documentary which charts the early months of Macclesfield FC.

title: The Papers: 999 calls crisis and MPs' rent expenses loophole
description: The papers cover record strains on the health service and more scrutiny of MPs' financial affairs.

title: Rare penguin makes 1800-mile journey to New Zealand
description: Pingu the penguin was spotted by a local resident who thought he was a "soft toy" at first.

title: The court orders depriving vulnerable children of their ‘liberty’
description: How vulnerable children in England are being detained in temporary accommodation under special "draconian" court orders.

title: US women are being jailed for having miscarriages
description: More and more American women are facing prison for allegedly harming their unborn baby by using drugs.

title: The resurrection of Swedish House Mafia: We are like three Doberman dogs
description: They were the biggest dance act in the world, and then they split up. Here's what happened next.

title: At Iraq's election protest camp, militia supporters dig in
description: Tensions grow as defiant groups vow to stay put until election results are overturned.

title: How high-speed electric vehicle racing is advancing tech
description: From rally cars to scooters new electric racing competitions are a test bed for new technology.

title: Seven ways to curb climate change
description: What are the practical things countries need to do in order to tackle climate change?
